name: About some pics
template:
title: About some pics tags: pics > These images were from an EARLY design of TW5-Node-RED prior to many features and custom nodes. Keep them around for sentimental reasons - If updated with the new nodes these flows would still work ;) Only a single `wiki in` node is required to get all the messages from TiddlyWiki clients:
{{single wiki in.png}}
Another method is to use multiple `wiki in` nodes, which can in some cases can make the flows more natural looking and easier to understand. Exporting a flow is also easier and more reliable as can include the `wiki in` node with the export.
{{multi wiki in.png}}
When using multiple `wiki in` nodes, care should be taken not to connect two `wiki in` nodes to the same flow. It would still work but the flow would be executed by Node-Red twice - impacting performance.
{{wrong wiki in.png}}

name: About same pics
template:
title: About same pics tags: pics > These images were from an EARLY design of TW5-Node-RED prior to many features and custom nodes. Keep them around for sentimental reasons - If updated with the new nodes these flows would still work ;) Only a single `wiki in` node is required to get all the messages from TiddlyWiki clients:
{{single wiki in.png}}
Another method is to use multiple `wiki in` nodes, which can in some cases can make the flows more natural looking and easier to understand. Exporting a flow is also easier and more reliable as can include the `wiki in` node with the export.
{{multi wiki in.png}}
When using multiple `wiki in` nodes, care should be taken not to connect two `wiki in` nodes to the same flow. It would still work but the flow would be executed by Node-Red twice - impacting performance.
{{wrong wiki in.png}}

template: title: Login mustache: yes userid: {%network.user.userid%} username: {%network.user.username%} email: {%network.user.email%} !!! Login documentation |''userid'':|{{!!userid}}| |''username'':|{{!!username}}| |''email'':|{{!!email}}| <$button actions="<>"> Create Account <$button actions="<>"> Sign in <$button actions="<>"> Sign off > The system is currently under construction - so currently allows a user to enter a username and will authorize them. Can see the system in the Network' and 'Connect' tabs of the flow editor. The Authentication and Authorization system is a template for application developers. The flows have been wired assuming the following steps will be used - but of course can be changed to match authorization requirements. * Login screen allowing a user to Sign in or Register * If user Registers - displays the registration screen ** Verify the email - or whatever using to authenticate ** Success - return to login screen ** Fail - return to Registration screen * If user Signs in ** Verify the user is Registered ** Success - set the user as authorized ** Fail - returns to Login screen When a user is logged in, user info is added to 'msg.network.user' for every message received and deleted from the message when responding to the user. if anonymous access is allowed set the allowAnon flag in ./settings.js allowing all users to be initially logged in as 'Guest'. Use `<>` to present a login screen. ---

+======+ title: $:/palette $:/themes/nico/notebook/palettes/palette-grey

name: Styles
Tiddlers
template:
title: $:/SiteSubtitle +======+ title: $:/themes/tiddlywiki/vanilla/settings/backgroundimage +======+ title: ·node-red· color: #8f0000 list: ·node-red· created: 19700102000000000 modified: 19700102000000000
· · · · ·
Tiddlers tagged with `·node-red·` have been sent to this wiki by the Node-Red server. Any tags that begin with a middle-dot `·` will be removed in-flight when sent to the server. Think of it as a client side //temporary// tag. Tags that start with a middle-dot will appear square-ish <> instead of the normal round-ish <> > Since most keyboards do not have a middle-dot key - click the <> pill and select top-most entry `·node-red·`. and copy/paste one from top or bottom of this tiddler.
· · · · ·
+======+ title: TW5-Node-RED tags: tw5-node-red clientId: <%network.meta._clientid%> created: 19700102000000000 modified: 19700102000000000 {{$:/temp/tw5-node-red/netstat}} Can load <$button actions="<>"> TW5-Node-RED Plugin, which contains information about TW5-Node-RED and stays pretty much hidden away in the Control Panel. The TW5-Node-RED ''application'' however changes the appearance, palette, adds a bunch of tiddlers, stuff like that. If connecting to server with your own wiki then probably would not run the application. Of course can just reload the page to start over again. Load <$button actions="<>"> TW5-Node-RED Application. +======+ title: tw5-node-red color: #334e7e list: tw5-node-red created: 19700102000000000 modified: 19700102000000000 TW5-Node-RED allows building server APIs for single file TiddlyWikis using Node-RED flows. Nodes have been designed to manage TiddlyWiki tiddlers and interface tiddlers to standard (and most third party) nodes. A TiddlyWiki macro provides TiddlyWiki's access to the server allowing tiddlers to be sent to and received from the server. Due to browser security concerns, the TiddlyWiki must be delivered by the server. Any TiddlyWiki can access the Node-Red server by drag-n-drop [[$:/plugins/potofcoffee2go/tw5-node-red/network.js]] and saving the single file TiddlyWiki in server directory 'uibuilder/svr/tiddlywikis'. Server side tiddlers can be from the connected TiddlyWikis, web, files, msg.property, or stored in Node-Red flows. The TiddlyWiki Core is embedded into Node-Red allowing the Node-Red 'function' node full access to the TiddlyWiki codebase (ie: $tw functions and objects). Tiddlers can be stored in server side TiddlyWiki wikis (twikis) allowing the server to access databases of tiddlers using standard TW filters. !! TiddlyWiki Requests contain a topic to inform the server which Node-Red flow is to be executed. Client TiddlyWiki tiddlers are sent to the server by providing a filter of the tiddlers to send. `<>` would send topic 'topic' and the tiddler titled 'tiddlers to send'. !! Node-RED Tiddler exchange is managed using the `msg.network` property maintained by all the nodes in the Node-Red 'Tiddler' category: * create tiddler, read tiddler, get network, set network, to twiki, from twiki. Tiddlers can be in .tid or JSON format, the Mustache logic-less template system is available for content substitution. TW5-Node-RED allows multiple tiddlers in .tid format by separating them using the line `+======+`. The server can dynamically request tiddlers from client TiddlyWikis at any time using standard TW filters. Tiddlers and plugins can be preloaded into the Node-Red embedded TiddlyWiki for additional or custom server side tiddler processing. See TW5-Node-Red Documentation for details --- +======+ title: $:/plugins/potofcoffee2go/tw5-node-red/credits/page tags: tw5-node-red caption: TNR Credits type: text/vnd.tiddlywiki
! TW5-Node-RED Designed and initial commit by [ext[PotOfCoffee2Go|https://github.com/potofcoffee2go]]
The main packages are [ext[Node-RED|https://nodered.org]], [ext[TiddlyWiki|https://tiddlywiki.com]], and [ext[uibuilder|https://totallyinformation.github.io/node-red-contrib-uibuilder/#/]] (node-red-contrib-uibuilder). ---
[ext[node.js|https://nodejs.org]], [ext[GIMP|https://www.gimp.org]], [ext[GitHub|https://github.com]], [ext[inkscape|https://inkscape.org]], [ext[git|https://git-scm.com]], [ext[geany|https://www.geany.org]], [ext[docsify|https://docsify.js.org]], and [ext[nodemon|https://nodemon.io]] were used to develop the project. --- Many online developer resources: [ext[Talk TiddlyWiki|https://talk.tiddlywiki.org/]], [ext[MDN|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/]], [ext[TW Icons v1.10|https://morosanuae.github.io/tw-icons/]], [ext[StackOverflow|https://stackoverflow.com/]], [ext[W3 Schools|https://www.w3schools.com/]], [ext[pixabay|https://pixabay.com/]], [ext[JSON Beautifier|https://jsonbeautifier.org/]], [ext[YouTube|https://www.youtube.com]] --- Developed on: [ext[Raspberry|https://www.raspberrypi.com]] [ext[Pi 4B|https://datasheets.raspberrypi.com/rpi4/raspberry-pi-4-datasheet.pdf]], [ext[LXDE Desktop|https://www.lxde.org]], [ext[Raspberry Pi OS (32-bit)|https://www.raspberrypi.com/software/]] TiddlyWiki: v5.3.1, Node-RED: v3.0.2, Node.js: v14.21.3, Linux: 5.10.103-v7l+ arm LE Chromium: 92.0.4515.98 (Official Build) Built on Raspbian --- Copyright and Trademarks are property of respective packages. No company is affiliated with or endorses TW5-Node-RED. +======+ title: TW5-Node-RED Flow Editor created: 19700102000000000 modified: 19700102000000000 +======+ title: $:/language/Snippets/node-red-button caption: TW5-Node-RED Button tags: $:/tags/TextEditor/Snippet <$button actions="<>"> Hello +======+ title: $:/tw5-node-red/username caption: {% network.user.username %} tags: mustache: yes {% network.user.username %}

title: $:/tw5-node-red/button
tags: $:/tags/EditorToolbar
caption: {{$:/language/Buttons/Bold/Caption}}
condition: [<targetTiddler>!has[type]] [<targetTiddler>type[text/vnd.tiddlywiki]]
condition-disabled: [[$:/temp/bold/disabled]get[state-disabled]else[no]]
icon: $:/tw5-node-red/node_red_logo_16pt.svg
shortcuts: 
description: Creates button of a TW5-Node-RED topic

<$action-sendmessage
	$message="tm-edit-text-operation"
	$param="save-selection"
	tiddler="$:/temp/currentSelection"
/>
<$action-sendmessage
	$message="tm-edit-text-operation"
	$param="insert-text"
	text={{{ [[<$button actions="<<node-red ']] =[{$:/temp/currentSelection}] [['>>"> ]] =[{$:/temp/currentSelection}] [[ </$button>]] +[join[]] }}}
/>
+======+
title: $:/language/Snippets/node-red-button
tags: $:/tags/TextEditor/Snippet
caption: Node-RED button

+======+
title: $:/language/Snippets/node-red-button/prefix

<$button actions="<<node-red '
+======+
title: $:/language/Snippets/node-red-button/suffix

'>>"> nodered_button </$button>
+======+
title: $:/language/Snippets/node-red-macro
tags: $:/tags/TextEditor/Snippet
caption: Node-RED macro

<<node-red 'hello' '[[tiddlers_to_send]]'>>

+======+
title: $:/language/Snippets/node-red-button-send
tags: $:/tags/TextEditor/Snippet
caption: Node-RED button w/send tiddlers

<$button actions="<<node-red 'hello' '[[tiddlers_to_send]]'>>"> Hello </$button>

name:
The second output on 'to-twiki' nodes triggers whenever that twiki 
 is updated regardless of where in the workspace. 
 These flows load database on startup and automatically write updates to disk.
Tracking of socket.io socket id changes \n Low-level stuff \n Change with caution
Show all clientIds &  twiki databases in debug panel

Do not want to automatically write the TiddlyWiki twiki database 
 to disk with every update? 
  just disconnect the wire 
 
 This includes updates done in the 'function' nodes too!
Load Chat rooms twiki from ./tiddlywiki/db/rooms.json
